channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world

item.title: Tanzania President Hassan wins disputed election with more than 97% of vote, official results show
item.description: DODOMA, Tanzania (AP) — Tanzanian President Samia Suluhu Hassan won the country’s disputed election with more than 97% of the vote, according to official results announced early Saturday, in a rare landslide victory in the region.
item.dc:creator: RODNEY MUHUMUZA, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Wicker, Reed demand Hegseth share Caribbean strike orders
item.description: Sens. Jack Reed (D-R.I.) and Roger Wicker (R-Miss.) on Friday called on Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth to give them copies of the orders issued to strike boats in the Caribbean that the Trump administration says were trafficking drugs. They released two letters addressed to Hegseth.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Mancini, The Hill

item.title: Red Cross confirms remains of three hostages return to Israel ‘for the first time’ as families await answers
item.description: The International Red Cross oversaw a body transfer under humanitarian law as parties work to return the deceased to families during the ongoing Israel-Hamas conflict.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Americans more likely to oppose boat strikes, military invasion of Venezuela: Survey
item.description: A YouGov survey has found that Americans are more likely to oppose U.S. strikes against boats near Venezuela than support them after a month of attacks on vessels suspected of transporting drugs off the country’s coast. Americans also strongly opposed the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Surina Venkat, The Hill

item.title: Israel's military prosecutor admits she leaked video of soldiers assaulting a Palestinian detainee
item.description: Israel’s top military prosecutor has resigned after admitting to leaking a video showing soldiers assaulting a Palestinian detainee.
item.dc:creator: Julia Frankel, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Militia attack on hospital in Darfur came in waves, WHO says
item.description: The World Health Organization reports that gunmen who reportedly killed at least 460 people at a hospital in Sudan's Darfur region returned three times to the facility during their assault.
item.dc:creator: Jamey Keaten And Sarah El Deeb, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Pakistan says it seeks no further escalation but urges Afghanistan to act against militants
item.description: ISLAMABAD (AP) — Pakistan does not seek further escalation of hostilities with Afghanistan but expects the South Asian country's Taliban rulers to address its security concerns by taking action against militants operating from Afghan soil, Pakistan’s Foreign Ministry said Friday.
item.dc:creator: MUNIR AHMED, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Royal prerogative: King Charles III banishes Andrew to buttress the House of Windsor's foundations
item.description: No one is bigger than the monarchy. Not even the king’s brother. In the end, that reality spelled the end of Andrew’s life as a prince of the realm.
item.dc:creator: DANICA KIRKA, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Russia deploys 170,000 troops for push in Ukraine's Donetsk region, Zelenskyy says
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Russia has deployed around 170,000 troops in Ukraine’s eastern Donetsk region where they are trying to capture the stronghold of Pokrovsk in a major push for a battlefield victory, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Friday.
item.dc:creator: ILLIA NOVIKOV, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Aid teams flock to Jamaica to help with Hurricane Melissa recovery
item.description: David Archer, deputy governor of the British Virgin Islands, told NewsNation he's seen many organizations eager to help.
item.dc:creator: Anna Kutz, NewsNation

item.title: New inquest rules South African Nobel laureate Albert Luthuli was beaten to death in 1967
item.description: CAPE TOWN, South Africa (AP) — A new inquest into the 1967 death of South African Nobel Peace Prize winner and anti-apartheid leader Albert Luthuli has found that he was beaten to death, and it rejected a previous finding that he died as a result of being hit by a train.
item.dc:creator: GERALD IMRAY, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Latvian Parliament votes to withdraw from domestic violence treaty
item.description: WARSAW, Poland (AP) — The Latvian Parliament voted Thursday to withdraw from the Istanbul Convention, a treaty aimed at supporting women who are victims of violence, after a 13-hour session of intense debate.
item.dc:creator: CLAUDIA CIOBANU, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Ex-Mossad chief behind Iran nuclear warehouse raid says Iran’s atomic sites ‘obliterated,’ credits Trump
item.description: Former Mossad director reveals Iran's nuclear sites were "obliterated" in U.S. strikes, warns Tehran that Israel "can come again" if uranium enrichment resumes.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: US defense chief vows to 'stoutly defend' Indo-Pacific interests in talks with China
item.description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia (AP) — The U.S. Secretary of Defense said Friday he told his Chinese counterpart during talks in Malaysia that Washington would “stoutly defend” its interests in the Indo-Pacific. He also signed a new agreement aimed at strengthening security ties with India.
item.dc:creator: EILEEN NG, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Giuffre family welcomes Andrew's fall from royal status but wants more action
item.description: King Charles III has stripped his brother Andrew of his princely title and home amid mounting pressure to address his ties to Jeffrey Epstein.
item.dc:creator: Jill Lawless And Brian Melley, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Security forces and protesters clash following disputed election in Tanzania; UN says 10 dead
item.description: Protests in Tanzania have entered their third day as the electoral body continues to announce the results of an election that sparked deadly demonstrations, leading to the government’s shutdown of the internet and the deployment of the military.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Haiti, Jamaica and Cuba pick up the pieces after Melissa's destruction
item.description: SANTIAGO DE CUBA, Cuba (AP) — The rumble of large machinery, whine of chain saws and chopping of machetes echoed through communities across the northern Caribbean on Thursday as they dug out from the destruction of Hurricane Melissa and surveyed the damage left behind.
item.dc:creator: ARIEL FERNÁNDEZ, ANDREA RODRÍGUEZ and JOHN MYERS JR., Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Cruise ship allegedly leaves 80-year-old woman behind on island, daughter demands answers after death
item.description: Family demands coronial inquest after cruise ship allegedly abandons 80-year-old passenger on remote Australian island, leading to her death during luxury voyage.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Death toll from Rio de Janeiro police raid on drug gang rises to 121
item.description: RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) — The death toll in a massive police raid targeting a drug trafficking gang in Rio de Janeiro rose to at least 121 people, authorities said Thursday.
item.dc:creator: ELÉONORE HUGHES and GABRIELA SÁ PESSOA, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Over 100 killed in Brazil’s deadliest police raid as Rio authorities battle drug gangs in favelas
item.description: Brazil’s deadliest police raid left 132 dead in Rio de Janeiro as officers clashed with gangs using drones and explosives in the city’s favelas.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: US orders nonemergency personnel to leave Mali
item.description: The State Department ordered non-emergency employees to leave Mali as the government there comes under increasing pressure from al Qaeda-linked insurgents.
item.dc:creator: Daphne Psaledakis, NewsNation

item.title: Guy Kopelowicz, former Paris photo chief for AP, dies at 85
item.description: Guy Kopelowicz, whose distinguished career editing and leading photo coverage for The Associated Press in France lasted more than four decades, has died. He was 85.
item.dc:creator: TONY HICKS, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: King Charles III strips Prince Andrew of titles and evicts him from royal residence
item.description: King Charles III is stripping his brother Prince Andrew of his remaining titles and evicting him from his royal residence, Buckingham Palace said Thursday.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: This Swiss village has been swamped and now it’s snowed under. They’re slowly digging their way out
item.description: BLATTEN, Switzerland (AP) — When a devastating landslide all but swallowed his Swiss village and toppled his three-generation family-owned hotel in May, Lukas Kalbermatten was overwhelmed by a sense of emptiness before the emotions hit.
item.dc:creator: JAMEY KEATEN, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: 5 more arrests as Louvre jewel heist probe deepens and key details emerge
item.description: PARIS (AP) — The dragnet tightened around the Louvre thieves on Thursday. Five more people were seized in the crown-jewels heist — including a suspect tied by DNA — the Paris prosecutor said, widening the sweep across the capital and its suburbs.
item.dc:creator: THOMAS ADAMSON and ANGELA CHARLTON, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Five more arrested in Louvre heist investigation as stolen crown jewels worth $102M still missing
item.description: Five more arrests made in Louvre heist investigation as French crown jewels worth $102 million remain missing after daring daytime theft from Paris museum.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Hegseth announces new strike on alleged narco-trafficking boat, killing 4
item.description: The military campaign comes as the U.S. has turned up pressure against Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro.
item.dc:creator: Filip Timotija, NewsNation

item.title: Hegseth says military conducted another strike on boat carrying alleged narco-terrorists
item.description: The U.S. military targeted another alleged narco-trafficking boat, sparking congressional concerns over due process and legal authority for the deadly strikes.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: As Trump meets Xi, Republicans push for release of detained Americans
item.description: The meeting between Trump and Xi in South Korea is largely focused on coming to a ceasefire in an escalating trade war.
item.dc:creator: Laura Kelly, NewsNation

item.title: Putin says Russia's nuclear-armed underwater drone was tested successfully
item.description: MOSCOW (AP) — Russia has conducted a successful test of a new atomic-powered and nuclear-capable underwater drone, President Vladimir Putin said Wednesday, declaring that the new weapon can't be intercepted.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Hamas victim memorial featuring Shiri Bibas and sons targeted by vandals in Milan, Italy
item.description: Artist AleXsandro Palombo calls the defacement of his Bibas family memorial mural in Milan an antisemitic act disguised as activism rather than legitimate protest.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Amnesty says deadly US strike on Yemen prison may be a war crime
item.description: An American airstrike in April on a prison run by Yemen's Houthi rebels killed more than 60 detained African migrants.
item.dc:creator: JON GAMBRELL, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: US sending strike boats to Venezuela for 'shock and awe' effect: Senator
item.description: "I think maybe the president is sending a message that, look, we're serious about it," Sen. Mike Rounds told "On Balance.
item.dc:creator: Rob Taub, NewsNation

item.title: Gaza ceasefire tested as Israel and Hamas exchange fire and blame
item.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The Israeli army launched a barrage of attacks in Gaza on Tuesday as tensions with Hamas grew two weeks into a fragile ceasefire, and the militant group responded by saying it would delay handing over the body of a hostage.
item.dc:creator: WAFAA SHURAFA and RENATA BRITO, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Ukraine's long-range strikes cut Russia's oil refining capacity by 20%, Zelenskyy says
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Ukraine’s long-range strikes on refineries inside Russia have reduced Moscow’s oil refining capacity by 20%, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, citing intelligence from Western governments.
item.dc:creator: SAMYA KULLAB, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Half of uncontacted Indigenous groups could be gone in decade: Report
item.description: "These are what I would call silent genocides — there are no TV crews, no journalists," said Survival International's Fiona Watson.
item.dc:creator: Rob Taub, NewsNation

item.title: Suspects arrested over the theft of crown jewels from Paris' Louvre museum
item.description: PARIS (AP) — Two suspects were arrested in connection with the theft of crown jewels from Paris’ Louvre museum, justice and police officials said Sunday, a week after the heist that stunned the world and sparked a massive manhunt.
item.dc:creator: SAMUEL PETREQUIN and NICOLAS GARRIGA, Associated Press, WFLA, NBC
